text: Does anyone know how this is handled in Ember?
I never thought of the right click issue before
or is it just bad practise to add an action on an Anchor link anyway?
> This works well for certain types of UI widgets; but, it's not really appropriate for widgets that render traditional anchor tags.
Widgets rendering anchor tags?
components with anchor tags in them
From what I can gather the issue is less about anchor tags and more about making sure scroll position is maintained?
no thats not the issue at all, a right click wouldn't fire an action on a anchor tag
so if that action was necessary to set a new state, which in turn updates the url of that anchor tag, that would never happen
Ah right. So its an anchor tag _with_ an action on it
Hmm, seems like very much an edge case to want a link that manipulates the state and then anchors to a position on a page?
yeah I agree
An aside but worth noting is `allowedKeys` when using actions <https://guides.emberjs.com/v2.8.0/templates/actions/#toc_allowing-modifier-keys>
hmm, so Ember kinds has this covered, I wonder if that works for the `cmd` key
surely `cmd + click` goes straight back up to the browser's control
I stumbled on this with Filltray where I wanted to always open certain links in a new tab.
since its a shortcut to the context menu option of open in new tab/window
<https://ember-twiddle.com/db593cd20a5ad33bdab3d7c0eddc0bd3>

attachments.title: Ember Twiddle
attachments.text: A web-based Ember.js code sharing tool that follows ember-cli's conventions.

text: <@U0ASPMFPS> The fiddle doesn't do anchor tags well but is this along the lines of what the problem is?
TBH I'm not even sure what the desired outcome is.
I don't get the issue
if you open a click in a new window
the app will load the proper route, with the proper data
to the extent the url contains enough information
I understand that a properly constructed URL should contain enough data to allow it to be shared via slack
maybe some details like whether or not the sidebar is expanded is not worth serializing in the URL
but things like `/admin/classes/1/students?filter[name]=Jon&sort=name,-age`

contains the ID of the class and enough information about filtering/sorting to allow whoever opens that url to see the same data, assuming the data is not contextual to the session and both have permissions
yeah I think the use case he is asking about is a bit random
he wants the state of the url to be modified on click of the anchor tag and redirects after that
this wouldn't be possible if you are right clicking, but I am not sure why you would do that in either case

I’ve wrote some thoughts on Ember Fingerprinting and dynamic assets, would love some feedback :slightly_smiling_face: - <https://medium.com/@ruslanzavacky/ember-cli-fingerprinting-and-dynamic-assets-797a298d8dc6>

Also, I’ve created an addon to solve this particular problem - <https://github.com/RuslanZavacky/ember-cli-ifa>
